intro: Hieracium maureri, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Hieracium maureri is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
